content.description: Start on a large crimp rail - climb up and right through crimps to a few compression moves on slopers - finish with an awesome throw to the lip
Start on opposing holds and traverse right through awesome pinches and slopers to a challenging top out over a sub-par landing. Classic Elden
Sit start on crimps - climb straight up the streaked face to good holds on the top out - can also be climbed from good holds on the left arete, making it a bit easier avoiding the cruxy sit-start.
content.location: Easily Visible from Skeletor and the main trail

content.description: Sit start on a hollow sounding flake to the right of The Streaker’s start. Climb left through good techy moves and crimps to reach the large edge in the middle of The Streaker and finish as for that problem.
content.location: Just to the right of Streaker

content.description: Small crimps up a technical face... could use a good cleaning.
content.location: Establish on the face and cruise up to the top

content.description: Somewhat difficult getting off the ground to an easy finish on slabby huecos
content.location: As you hike up the main trail Skelotor is right off the Trail on the left.

content.description: Stand start on sloping edges, Tech. your way up the slight slab to better holds near the top. Due to recent flooding the landing has been washed out a bit.
content.location: Continue past Skeletor and Tony's Problem. The old school boulder is 25-50 feet past Tony's problem on the left,

content.description: Stand start and climb up the left arete on mostly good holds and smeary feet. Top out somewhere near the crest of the boulder. There's also an eliminate that starts on small crimps just to the right and climbs straight up not using the arete.
content.location: A stone's throw past Tony;s problem

content.description: This little lowball climbs way better than it looks. Squat start on lowest compression holds. Climb up and right and top out on the xenolith that often fills with coyote poop. Difficult boulder to flash!
content.location: Continue past Tony's problem. This little guy is just past the Old School slab.

content.description: Sit start as for Tony's arete but trend left and finish on Diamond Slab.
content.location: Facing Skeletor these problems are within a stone's throw to the right

content.description: Stand Start matched on a good edge, climb straight up on good edges to a mellow top out.
content.protection: A few pads, decent landing but there is a rock to the right of the problem.
content.location: Hike up the main trail to Middle Elden, The Streaker boulder is just off the right side of the trail, the first boulders you come to. Exhibition is just right of The Streaker.

content.description: Climb up the Diamond slab starting on awful slopers in a mantle like dihedral start. This problem eases significantly after establishing on the slab. Trad masters will probably have a pretty easy time with this one but who knows.
content.location: Right in the middle of the Diamond Slab. Looking straight at "The Streaker" bump around the corner to the right to find this boulder nearby.

content.description: Pull onto an undercling just left of Tony's arete and climb up the slab on mostly positive holds.
Start on jugs under the belly of the Chalk stone. Climb up and around to find a distinct crux right before the lip.
content.location: Continue past Tony's problem and the Old School slab, this problem is found on the left side of the canyon a few hundred feet past. If you hike up past the slippery rock slab you have gone too far.

content.description: Start on Big jugs, trend up and right eventually rocking over onto a slab. Be careful as the crux is up high and the landing is not good. Better not to fall off this one.
content.protection: A few pads, bad landing. best not to fall
content.location: Look for an incut jug rail left of Old School arete, a stone's throw from Tony's Problem

content.description: This is the first area you come to in Middle Elden and offers some good warm ups and also some more challenging problems. Tends to be sunny for most of the day.
